org.zaproxy.zap.extension.spider

Class SpiderThread

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • org.zaproxy.zap.model.ScanThread
        • org.zaproxy.zap.extension.spider.SpiderThread
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable, GenericScanner, SpiderListener

    public class SpiderThread
extends ScanThread
implements SpiderListener
    The Class SpiderThread that controls the spidering process on a particular site. Being a ScanThread, it also handles the update of the graphical UI and any other "extension-level" required actions.

      • spiderComplete

        public void spiderComplete(boolean successful)
        Description copied from interface: SpiderListener
        Event triggered when the spider is finished. This event is triggered either when the spider has completed scanning a website, in which case the parameter successful is true , either when it was stopped by an user in which case the successful parameter is false.
        Specified by:
        spiderComplete in interface SpiderListener
        Parameters:
        successful -
        • true - when the spider has scanned a website completely and finished by its own
        • false - when the spider was stopped by the user

      • foundURI

        public void foundURI(String uri,
            String method,
            FetchFilter.FetchStatus status)
        Description copied from interface: SpiderListener
        Event triggered when a new uri was found. The status parameter says if the URI was skipped according to any skip rule or it was processed.
        Specified by:
        foundURI in interface SpiderListener
        Parameters:
        uri - the uri
        method - the method used for accessing the uri
        status - the FetchFilter.FetchStatus stating if this uri will be processed, and, if not, stating the reason of the filtering

        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        percentageComplete - the percentage complete

      • setScanContext

        public void setScanContext(Context context)
        Description copied from interface: GenericScanner
        Sets the Context that should be scanned. The value should be used only if JustScanInScope is enabled. If the justScanInScope property is set, when the scan is started, it should be scan all the nodes in scope, if this StartContext is null, or all the nodes in context, if this StartContext is not null.
        Specified by:
        setScanContext in interface GenericScanner
        Parameters:
        context - the new scan context. If null, the scan will be run for all the nodes in scope.
        See Also:
        GenericScanner.setJustScanInScope(boolean), GenericScanner.getJustScanInScope()
